Package it.kibo.fp.lib

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
it.kibo.fp.lib.Menu
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Menu extends Object implements Serializable
The Menu class creates a menu with multiple entry supposing that zero is always the exit option. The class also contains some method that may result useful in visualizing the menu.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Alessandro Muscio
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Menu(String title, String[] entries, boolean useExitEntry, boolean centredTitle, boolean useVerticalFrame)
    Constructor that creates a Menu object specifying a title, the entries of the menu, if you want the exit entry or not, if you want the title centred and if you also want the vertical frame in the title.

  • Constructor Details

    • Menu

      public Menu(String title, String[] entries, boolean useExitEntry, boolean centredTitle, boolean useVerticalFrame)
      Constructor that creates a Menu object specifying a title, the entries of the menu, if you want the exit entry or not, if you want the title centred and if you also want the vertical frame in the title. It will also automatically calculate the frame length.
      Parameters:
      title - Represents the title of the menu.
      entries - Represents the entries of the menu.
      useExitEntry - If you want the exit entry or not.
      centredTitle - If you want the title to be centred or not.
      useVerticalFrame - If you want to use the vertical frame or not.

  • Method Details

    • choose

      public int choose()
      Prints the menu and lets the user choose an option from it.
      Returns:
      An int representing the choice of the user.

    • clearConsole

      public static void clearConsole()
      Clear any character from the console.

    • wait

      public static void wait(int milliseconds) throws InterruptedException
      Stops the program for a certain amount of milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      milliseconds - The number of milliseconds to stop the program.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.

    • loadingMessage

      public static void loadingMessage(String message) throws InterruptedException
      Prints a certain message simulating a loading by adding dots slowly.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - Read the wait method.
